Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Distension Pressure on Long Saphenous Vein Grafts in CABG

Trial_Design.evidence: 21 paired vein samples from CABG patients, randomised into non-distended (group A) and distended (group B) groups.

Participants.evidence: 21 paired vein samples from CABG patients

Intervention.evidence: randomised into non-distended (group A) and distended (group B) groups.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the impact of unregulated distension pressure on LSVG endothelium.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was endothelial cell loss, measured immediately post-procedure.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 21 paired vein samples from CABG patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: Distended veins exhibited significantly higher endothelial cell loss (31.95% ± 31.31) compared to non-distended veins (11.67% ± 28.65) (p = 0.034).
